results.title: The Teeth - development and care
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: This film deals with the care of the teeth, based on a knowledge of what teeth are, how they are formed, and the factors which effect their growth, formation, and preservation.

results.title: The Technique of artificial pneumothorax
results.brief_description: Apparatus used in the operation of applying artificial pneumothorax treatment in pulmonary tuberculosis (controlled collapse of the infected lung). Shows the induction in the lung wall; the refill in the lung wall; explains the treatment necessary to effect a complete cure.

results.title: The Teaching box
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ocko and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Describes the establishment of a revolutionary experiment in education which has been successfully launched in American Samoa - a group of six small islands. Seeking an expansion of their educational system, Samoans turned to closed circuit television for a solution. High quality education on both primary and secondary school levels is now transmitted daily throughout the islands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Ocko and United States Information Agency

results.title: The Teacher: authority or automaton?
results.creator_credit: Mort Ransen, Richard Gilbert and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: In our overflowing classrooms, are methods of mass production edging out traditional ways of education? This film offers a vocal sampling of opinion from across Canada. Teachers, administrators and high-ranking educators speak their minds freely about the problems facing education in Canada today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mort Ransen, Richard Gilbert and ONF | NFB

results.title: The Teacher and Technology (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Use of audiovisual equipment in the classroom. The technical sophistication is not as important as the usage and the input. Stresses need for careful selection of media to suit specific learning experience and students involved

results.title: The Taxi driver
results.creator_credit: Jean Roy, Louis Portugais and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Accompanies Gerry Lane, a taxi driver, on a few rides and presents a sampling of the parade of people, of all types and temperaments, that pass in and out of his cab in endless procession, all with very personal concerns but all with one thing in common - a desire to get somewhere in a hurry.

results.title: The Tasmanian tiger
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Linda Taylor and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Two tourists in search of Tasmania’s Thylacine or marsupial tiger, now probably extinct, see most of the island’s native animals in a zoo. Contains rare archival footage of a Tasmanian tiger in captivity and extensive footage of the Tasmanian devil.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Anderson, Linda Taylor and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production

results.title: The Task before the building industry
results.brief_description: A survey of the task of building still facing Britain - as a result of war-time destruction and also of modern progress in social standards. Millions of new houses, schools and public and private buildings and structures of all kinds are needed to replace the bombed and the outworn, and every use is being made of labour, machinery, and the extensive resources of civil enginerring.
results.description: A survey of the task of building still facing Britain - as a result of war-time destruction and also of modern progress in social standards. results.title: The Task ahead
results.brief_description: The peoples of the world want food, they want technical resources, they want scientific knowledge and above all they want peace. The film traces the history of UNESCO (United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organisation) and illustrates how, through this organisation, books, paintings and the tools of eduation are being supplied to the peoples of many lands.
